intro: Vateria nervosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is native to regions in Asia and Africa and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Vateria nervosa is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
